''Dor-nu-Fauglith'' | location=South of [[Ered Engrin]], west of [[Ered Luin]], north-west of [[Lothlann]], east of [[Ered Wethrin]] | type=Desert | description=Large, dry, dusty plain | regions= | towns= | inhabitants= | created={{FA|455}}, [[Dagor Bragollach]] | destroyed= | events= }} '''Anfauglith''' was the charred desert to the north of [[Beleriand]], created by the fires of [[Thangorodrim]] during the [[Dagor Bragollach]] ("Battle of Sudden Flame") in {{FA|455}}. It was originally the green plain of [[Ard-galen]].{{S|Fingolfin}} Anfauglith remained barren until after the [[Nirnaeth Arnoediad]], when one hill, the [[Haudh-en-Ndengin]] or "Hill of Slain", again was covered with long green grass.{{S|Fifth}} It was upon Anfauglith that [[Morgoth]] assembled his whole power in the [[War of Wrath]] yet they were conquered by the hosts of the West.{{S|Earendil}} ==Etymology== ''Anfauglith'' means "By Gasping Dust" in [[Sindarin]], from ''[[an]]-'' ("with, by") + ''[[faug]]'' ("thirsty, gasping"{{S|Appendix}}, ''faug'') + ''[[lith]]'' ("ash, sand, dust"{{S|Appendix}}, ''lith''). Another name was '''''Dor-nu-Fauglith''''' translated as "Land under Choking Ash". {{Pronounce|Anfauglith.mp3|Ardamir}} {{references}} [[Category:Beleriand]] [[Category:Sindarin locations]] [[Category:Fields, plains and deserts]] [[de:Ard-galen]] [[fi:Anfauglith]] [[fr:encyclo:geographie:regions:beleriand:anfauglith]]
